runners.name: Therussiancomposer
runners.comment: Soundly beaten in heavy ground at this track on return but can improve from that
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in three sprint maidens and on nursery debut last year; not much better in heavy ground at this track on return but can improve from that.

7:50.race_name: Save 33% Buying Tickets Online Handicap (Div I)
7:50.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (Watering)

runners.name: Escape Act
runners.comment: UK winner has been poor in three starts for this yard and isn't easy to fancy
runners.spotlight: UK winner over this trip on soft ground last year has been poor in three starts for this yard and isn't easy to fancy.

stable_tour.quote: He won well on juicy ground at Doncaster and then ran well at Wolverhampton in one of the Racing League races - that form has worked out okay. He enjoys soft ground and as soon as he gets those conditions he'll be seen to good effect. We're waiting for them at the moment but he's not finished for the season just yet. 04-09-24

runners.name: Harriet Eagle
runners.owner: Mrs Patrick J Flynn & Gavin Omahoney
runners.comment: A 7f winner at this track last year; not a bad AW run on return; needs best raised to 1m
runners.spotlight: Was a 7f winner at this track last year but disappointed over this trip here next time; not a bad AW run on return; needs best raised to 1m again.

runners.name: May Night
runners.comment: Seven of eight wins on AW; ground too soft at Cork last time and can do better
runners.spotlight: Seven of his eight wins have been on AW but won off 69 over this trip at Cork last year; ground was too soft on return at the same track last time and can do better back on this livelier ground.

runners.name: Mogwli
runners.comment: Last two wins have come over 1m on soft ground; not bad efforts lately incl' over 1m4f
runners.spotlight: Last two wins have come over 1m on soft ground; not bad efforts lately including over 1m4f last time but needs to get back to his best.

quotes.race: Barney Curley Charity Cup Handicap
quotes.quote: Mogwli took me there once I was able to take my time on him. Once I got past the horse in front he was able to pick up - Wesley Joyce, rider

quotes.race: NavanRacecourse.ie Handicap
quotes.quote: Mogwli broke well, there is lovely fresh ground on that rail and Jack just kept him happy. The horse fought them off well too - Willie McCreery, trainer.

quotes.race: TRM Hoofmaker Handicap
quotes.quote: Mogwli doesn't like the wind and having it behind him was the best thing for him. He rode a grand race and I loved the way he fought back at the finish - Willie McCreery, trainer.

quotes.race: Fairyhouse.ie Handicap
quotes.quote: Mogwli was bred by my wife. He's a tough and hardy little fellow and he loves racing. He'll be kept on the go for the apprentices to ride - Willie McCreery, trainer

runners.name: Harry The Rogue
runners.comment: Got off the mark over this trip at Naas last time; should be competitive off 4lb higher
runners.spotlight: Narrowly got off the mark at 20th attempt over this trip at Naas last time; should be competitive off 4lb higher and goes best on a sound surface.

runners.name: Higher Kingdom
runners.comment: Six AW wins but 0-26 on turf; fine run at Naas last time and can go well off same mark
runners.spotlight: Six AW wins but is 0-26 on turf; fine run at Naas last time when third to Harry The Rogue and can get closer to that rival off the same mark.

quotes.race: Floodlit Friday Nights At Dundalk Stadium Handicap
quotes.quote: Higher Kingdom is a talented horse. He travelled like a dream and he just did enough - John McConnell, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He has really progressed this winter as having won off 62 in December at Dundalk, he has since added two more wins at the track and is up to a rating of 86 now. The plan is to send him over to Lingfield on Good Friday for either the 1m or 1m2f race. Even though he's now at a career-high mark, I think there could be a little more to come. He's a very talented horse who was highly thought of as a juvenile, but like so many Kingmans he has a mind of his own and has taken a while to get back on track. He was disappointing last time out, but he seems grand at the moment and we'll almost certainly be claiming off him at Lingfield. I'm not entirely sure who'll get the ride but Siobhan Rutledge has won twice on him. 06-04-23

runners.name: Harseva
runners.comment: Placed once (1m2f) from nine starts; not as good since and poor on soft last time
runners.spotlight: Placed once (1m2f) from nine starts but not as good since that effort and was poor on soft last time.

runners.name: Asisaid
runners.owner: J Leigh & J Orourke & Teresa Leigh & Jenny Curley
runners.comment: The last of two wins back in 2023; not bad runs lately but needs more
runners.spotlight: The last of his two wins was back in 2023; however, not bad runs lately including when 5l behind Dinamine here last time; needs more.

quotes.race: O'Neill & Co. Apprentice Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Asisaid got his ground today and the blinkers helped. When he goes and does it he has plenty of ability. With the ground as it is we might go to Galway - Pat Murphy, trainer.

quotes.race: ITBA Next Generation Handicap
quotes.quote: Asisaid was a bit backward physically and mentally. We're delighted with that, we knew he'd do a job but we just didn't think he do it as quickly. He came to hand very quick this year - Pat Murphy, trainer.

runners.name: Jurality

prev_owners.owner: Straight To Victory Syndicate/Geoffrey Thorpe/Brian Bunyan
Straight To Victory Syndicate, Geoffrey Thorpe & Brian Bunya

runners.comment: Soundly beaten lately over 7f and 1m4f so has to do a fair bit more
runners.spotlight: Two hurdle runs earlier this year; soundly beaten lately over 7f and 1m4f so has to do a fair bit more.

runners.name: Suityourselfboss
runners.comment: AW winner ran a cracker over C&D last time and a repeat will see her go close
runners.spotlight: AW winner over this trip in 2024; ran a cracker over C&D last time and a repeat off the same mark will see her go close.

runners.name: Sayfa Fad
runners.comment: Went closest when second over 1m1f at Leopardstown last time; Keane and blinkers stay on
runners.spotlight: Maiden went closest when second over 1m1f at Leopardstown last time; Keane and blinkers stay on so should be a big player off 2lb higher.

runners.name: Gatsby Cap
runners.comment: Dual C&D winner has been soundly beaten on AW last twice and needs more
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner but has been soundly beaten on AW last twice and needs more off 2lb lower.

quotes.race: GAIN Equine Nutrition Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: Gatsby Cap is tough in fairness to him, he hasn't been spared. We'll just keep pooching away with him - Fozzy Stack, trainer.

quotes.race: LMFM Dual Race Night Friday 3rd May Handicap
quotes.quote: Gatsby Cap travelled well through the race and did it easily. He did it very easy off that rating and I can see him going well in better company - Andy Slattery, rider

runners.name: Sierra De Gredos
runners.comment: Now 5lb lower than when last seen and has to be ready on return
runners.spotlight: Beaten 4.5l at Dundalk over this trip when last seen; now 5lb lower but has to be ready on return.

runners.name: So Messi
runners.comment: Maiden has run well at times; needs to improve from Cork return
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose maiden has run well at times; needs to improve from Cork return but a repeat of his best would see a good run.

runners.name: Famous Enough
runners.comment: Maiden can only be watched on return from a long absence
runners.spotlight: Maiden can only be watched on return from a long absence with a hood added for a new yard.

runners.name: Gianh River
runners.owner: D J Mooney & Barry J Doyle
runners.comment: Makes debut for a new yard but hasn't shown enough to be interested in
runners.spotlight: Maiden makes debut for a new yard but hasn't shown enough to be interested in; tongue-tie on.

8:20.race_name: Save 33% Buying Tickets Online Handicap (Div II)
8:20.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (Watering)

runners.name: Hemight
runners.comment: Maiden ran a cracker at Dundalk but not as good on soft at Cork; this can suit better
runners.spotlight: Maiden after 12 starts; ran a cracker at Dundalk over 7f but not as good on soft at Cork over this trip; this faster ground can suit better and isn't out of this.

runners.name: Limestone Red
runners.comment: AW winner over 1m2.5f hasn't been at his best lately and this might be a bit sharp
runners.spotlight: AW winner over 1m2.5f hasn't been at his best lately and would have a squeak if returning to form, though this trip might be a bit sharp.

runners.name: Cherry Pink
runners.comment: Two wins last autumn; well beaten on return but can improve from that
runners.spotlight: Two wins last autumn from 6f to this trip; well beaten on return at Naas but can improve from that and run well.

runners.name: Jarvis Brook
runners.comment: Dual-purpose sort; went closest on Flat over 1m1.5f at this track last year; needs repeat
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose sort; went closest on the Flat over 1m1.5f at this track last year; needs a repeat on return.

runners.name: La La Lucrative
runners.comment: Won over 6f on heavy in UK last year; poor over various trips for this yard
runners.spotlight: Won over 6f on heavy in UK last year; poor over various trips for this yard and isn't easy to fancy on that form.

stable_tour.quote: He's taken some time to come together mentally. He's a bit of a sensitive soul. He ran three times last year, finishing third twice in small fields. We started him back at 5f this year at Beverley, where he was still learning, and have stepped him up to 6f for his next run, which will be at Catterick on Thursday. 23-05-24

runners.name: Seven Eleven
runners.comment: Won a 5f Down Royal nursery in 2023; regressed since and best watched
runners.spotlight: Won a 5f Down Royal nursery in 2023; has basically regressed since and is best watched on return.

quotes.race: Molson Coors Beverage Company Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: We changed Seven Eleven's training at home, we put a tongue bit on her to keep her tongue down. It had been getting over the bit and wasn't helping the jockeys, so through no fault of her own she has ended up well handicapped. She might go on the all-weather and I will use that program to educate and teach her - Johnny Levins, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Fleetfootsoldier
runners.comment: Three wins over this trip in 2023; beaten a long way on soft at Navan on return
runners.spotlight: Three wins over this trip in 2023; beaten a long way on soft at Navan on return and has to improve hugely on that.

runners.name: The Fog Horn
runners.comment: Both wins came over 7f here in 2023; basically regressive since and best watched
runners.spotlight: Both wins came over 7f here in 2023; has been basically regressive since and best watched.

quotes.race: Coast To Curragh Charity Cycle Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: The Fog Horn likes it here and likes a bit of better ground. It was a little bit too soft for her the last day and James gave her a great ride out in front today from a good draw. We'll see what the handicapper does, he gave her 12lb the last time she won which was plenty so we claimed off her today which made a difference - Seamus O'Donnell, trainer.

runners.name: Man Is King
runners.comment: Longstanding maiden but ran a cracker at Naas last time and shouldn't be far away
runners.spotlight: Longstanding maiden but several solid runs in defeat, mainly on AW but ran a cracker at Naas last time and shouldn't be far away; frontrunner.

runners.name: Eponine Etoile
runners.comment: Beaten a long way in three maidens over further and has to find huge improvement
runners.spotlight: Beaten a long way in three maidens over further and has to find huge improvement with cheekpieces even dropping to handicaps.

runners.name: Dinamine
runners.comment: Got off the mark on Flat at 35th try when winning over 7f (hvy) here last time; up 5lb
runners.spotlight: Got off the mark on the Flat at 35th try making stable/seasonal debut when winning over 7f (hvy) here last time; up 5lb and has handled good ground before so a big player.

runners.name: Glencullen
runners.comment: Maiden has run well several times in defeat and can do so again if ready on return
runners.spotlight: Maiden has run well several times in defeat over this trip and can do so again if ready enough on return.

runners.name: Eagles Whistle
runners.comment: Mild promise in maidens but no progression in handicaps and has to do much better
runners.spotlight: Mild promise in maidens but no progression in handicaps and has to do much better; tongue-tie and cheekpieces added.

runners.name: Bucky Larson
runners.comment: Seven-time winner but regressive in the last two years; a chance if building on last time
runners.spotlight: Seven-time winner but regressive in the last two years; however, has a chance if building on his solid Leopardstown 7f run last time.

quotes.race: Dundalk Stadium Claiming Race
quotes.quote: Bucky Larson has been coming down the handicap all year and I felt the last day that he was something like himself. He was entitled to do that - Colin Keane, rider

quotes.race: Naas Racecourse Handicap
quotes.quote: Bucky Larson has a bit of class in races like that. He's a good lead horse at home and pulls one out of the bag every so often - Shane Lyons, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: "Paddy & Saoirse Casey" Handicap
quotes.quote: Bucky Larson is still a baby of a horse but we think he'll get ten furlongs in time. He's a lovely individual, he's growing up and I'd say there's another day or two in him - Ger Lyons, trainer

quotes.race: Leopardstown Summer Pass Maiden
quotes.quote: We rode him all wrong at Dundalk. We don't take back from the stalls and it was just the wrong way to ride him.His work at home had been good and he loves hunting one down. That's what we were expecting him to do at Dundalk and we were disappointed last time but I'd rather win here - Ger Lyons, trainer

runners.name: Celtic Druid
runners.comment: Poor in three handicaps and isn't easy to fancy
runners.spotlight: Poor in three handicaps including on testing ground in cheekpieces at this track when last seen; isn't easy to fancy.

runners.name: Second Fiddle
runners.comment: Maiden ran well on return at Naas and can get closer with improvement off the same mark
runners.spotlight: Maiden ran well on return at Naas when 2.5l behind Man Is King and can get closer today with improvement off the same mark.

runners.name: Brave Of Friends
runners.comment: 0-8 and yet to seriously threaten in any of his starts; improvement needed to feature
runners.spotlight: 0-8 and yet to seriously threaten in any of his starts, including when dropped into this grade last time; significant improvement needed to feature.

runners.name: Podium
runners.comment: Off the mark in November and has run competitively off his higher rating since
runners.spotlight: Off the mark with a 6f victory here in November and has run competitively off his higher rating since; however, latest run was below expectations and he'll need to bounce back stepping up in trip.

runners.name: The Khan
runners.comment: Opened account in October; struggled to replicate that form off his revised rating since
runners.spotlight: Opened his account with a 7f win at Sha Tin in October; struggled to replicate that form off his revised rating since, but now back down to a workable mark.

runners.name: The Prime
runners.comment: Has shown flashes of ability in ten starts without making a serious impact; back on turf
runners.spotlight: Has shown flashes of ability in ten starts without making a serious impact; switches back to turf after failing to fire on the Sha Tin dirt the last twice.

runners.name: Tradition
runners.comment: Longstanding local maiden; produced a better effort when narrowly denied two starts back
runners.spotlight: Longstanding local maiden; produced one of his better efforts when narrowly denied over C&D two starts back; repeat of that performance would see him go close.

runners.name: Tattenham

prev_owners.owner: T G Heptinstall, Ms N J Cruickshank Et Al

runners.comment: Yet to get off the mark this season but recent third-place finish was a return to form
runners.spotlight: Yet to get off the mark this season but recent third-place finish on Sha Tin dirt was a return to form; capable off this mark and respected returning to turf.

runners.name: Super Treasure
runners.owner: Martin Yung Ping Fai & Kwok Yi Chit
runners.comment: Has generally disappointed in eight career starts so far, offering little encouragement
runners.spotlight: Has generally disappointed in eight career starts so far, offering little encouragement; best watched for now.

runners.name: Harrys Hero
runners.comment: Back to form with a close second over C&D two weeks ago; firmly in calculations
runners.spotlight: Gained 7f victory at Sha Tin late last year and bounced back to form with a close second over C&D two weeks ago; firmly in calculations if repeating that effort.

runners.name: On The Lash
runners.comment: Went close on New Year's Day; however, subsequent performances have been disappointing
runners.spotlight: 0-13; went close over 1m1f at Sha Tin on New Year's Day but subsequent performances have been disappointing and he needs a revival.

runners.name: Woodfire Champ
runners.comment: Scored a deserved breakthrough in October; remained consistent and competitive since
runners.spotlight: Scored a deserved breakthrough over 6f here in October; remained consistent and competitive since, and another bold bid is likely.

runners.name: Cool Blue
runners.breeder: B J Lindsay Mnzm & Mrs J E A Lindsay
runners.comment: Well handicapped on his best form but recent outings on the dirt have been below par
runners.spotlight: Longstanding maiden who is well handicapped based on his best form but recent outings on the Sha Tin dirt have been below par; revival required on today's return to turf.

runners.name: Beau Gosse
runners.comment: Frustrating maiden; signs of a return to form in December but failed to build on it since
runners.spotlight: Frustrating maiden who has slipped significantly in the weights; showed signs of a return to form when placed over the minimum trip at Sha Tin in December but failed to build on it since.

runners.name: Foremost Teddy
runners.owner: Tse Ming Yee & Emily Tse Wing Man
runners.comment: Has been threatening to breakthrough this season; dangerous if getting a run today
runners.spotlight: Has been threatening to breakthrough this season, notably when fading late after leading over C&D last time; dangerous if getting a run today.

runners.name: Strongest Boy
runners.owner: Ricky Wong Kin Chat & Helen Leung Yee Wan
runners.comment: C&D winner last season but has struggled badly in ten starts this term
runners.spotlight: C&D winner last season but has struggled badly in ten starts this term; significantly below his last winning mark.

runners.name: Notthesillyone
runners.comment: Wasn't beaten far when eased in grade last month; still has plenty to prove
runners.spotlight: Generally disappointing in seven career starts; wasn't beaten far when eased in grade last month but still has plenty to prove.

runners.name: Spicy Knuckles
runners.owner: Alex Ng Siu Ting & Zoe Yam Yee Lam
runners.comment: Sent off at big prices in all six career starts and has yet to offer much encouragement
runners.spotlight: Sent off at big prices in all six career starts and has yet to offer much encouragement; today's drop in class is not enough to make him of interest.

runners.name: Day Day Victory
runners.owner: Alan Kiang Ping Fai & Joyce Lee
runners.comment: Off the mark over C&D last month; 5lb rise asks a question; drawn well
runners.spotlight: Took a step forward when getting off the mark over C&D last month; 5lb rise asks a question but he has the inside draw to work from today.

runners.name: Ragnarr
runners.comment: Hinting at a breakthrough in recent times; surely only a matter of time before he strikes
runners.spotlight: Longstanding local maiden who has been hinting at a breakthrough in recent times; surely only a matter of time before he gets his head in front; today's wide draw a slight concern.

runners.name: Happy Tango
runners.comment: Won twice over C&D earlier in the season but has gone quiet in recent months
runners.spotlight: Won twice over C&D earlier in the season but has gone quiet in recent months; current mark still leaves him with something to prove.

runners.name: Ruby Sailing
runners.owner: Michael Chan Se Ping & Law Lai Wan
runners.comment: Hit the frame twice in novice company but hasn't built on that promise in handicaps
runners.spotlight: Hit the frame twice in novice company but hasn't built on that promise in handicaps; latest run was disappointing and he needs to bounce back.

runners.name: Modest Gentleman
runners.comment: Dual C&D winner last term and has been knocking on the door again this season
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner last term and has been knocking on the door again this season; solid chance if able to recapture his best form.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Auction Maiden (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Special Power has been the cause of his own downfall a few times but he got it right tonight. If he's alright we might go to Naas on Sunday for the Birdcatcher - Andy Slattery, trainer

runners.name: Gusty Fighter
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Ken Hui Chi Kit
runners.comment: Yet to strike in nine starts and has finished down the field in all three runs this season
runners.spotlight: Yet to strike in nine career starts and has finished down the field in all three runs this season; hard to support on current evidence.

runners.name: Life Of Stone
runners.comment: No threat in eight starts to date and looks one to avoid for now
runners.spotlight: No threat in eight starts to date and looks one to avoid for now.

runners.name: Speedy Fortune
runners.breeder: J W Kelly Suffolk Vale & Co
runners.comment: On a long losing streak and recent efforts have lacked spark; needs to show plenty more
runners.spotlight: On a long losing streak and recent efforts have lacked spark; needs to show more before becoming a serious contender again.

runners.name: Wood On Fire
runners.comment: Made a promising return in September but form has tailed off; needs to turn a corner
runners.spotlight: Made a promising seasonal return in September but form has tailed off; needs to turn a corner if he's to get competitive here.

runners.name: Ace Talent
runners.comment: Last success came over a year ago but he's gone close more than once this season
runners.spotlight: Last success came over a year ago but he's gone close more than once this season; capable of featuring if everything falls right.

runners.name: Chateau Le Peche
runners.breeder: B J Lindsay Mnzm & Mrs J E A Lindsay
runners.comment: Gained a breakthrough win over 1m2f at Sha Tin last month; uncertain over today's trip
runners.spotlight: Gained a breakthrough win over 1m2f at Sha Tin last month; 5lb rise to overcome and it's uncertain whether today's drop in trip will suit.

runners.name: Cheer For South
runners.owner: Chan Man Chun, James Mathew Fong Et Al
runners.comment: Shed his maiden tag over 6f on the Sha Tin dirt in March; respected if he makes the cut
runners.spotlight: Shed his maiden tag over 6f on the Sha Tin dirt in March and backed that up with a solid effort off his new mark; respected if he makes the cut.

runners.name: Cant Go Wong
runners.breeder: J S Alexander, W Bevins Et Al

prev_owners.owner: Ciaron Maher Racing, M Tsang Et Al

runners.comment: Three-time runner-up here since 1m1f scorer off 8lb lower in December; up in trip.
runners.spotlight: Caught close home over 1m1f here on his last two starts; clearly in good heart and this step up to 1m3f is an interesting move (ran poorly on only previous Hong Kong try but Group 2-placed at 1m2f in Australia).

runners.name: Midori Giant
runners.comment: Held on recent C&D form; still unexposed and may improve for the fitting of a tongue-tie.
runners.spotlight: Yet to crack the top three in six Hong Kong attempts and finished behind five of these over C&D three weeks ago; down another 2lb with tongue-tie applied.

runners.name: Serangoon

prev_owners.owner: D Mason, Dr C A Broxham Et Al

runners.comment: Suited by this C&D and race was not run to suit when third last time so should go well.
runners.spotlight: Has a good C&D record (including win off 5lb lower mark in February) and did well to hold on for share of 2.25l third having made mid-race dash for the lead three weeks ago; 7lb better off with the winner, Management Folks.

runners.name: Romantic Fantasy
runners.comment: Lightly raced C&D winner; caught the eye with late progress into fifth last time.
runners.spotlight: C&D winner who showed much more on his second start since a long break when staying on late into fifth having been outpaced over C&D three weeks ago; should progress again.

runners.name: Ocean Impact
runners.comment: Three modest runs and one good one thus far; first try at beyond 1m.
runners.spotlight: Just four starts to date, and one (close second over 1m as a 31-1 chance on penultimate outing) much better than the others; stepping up from 1m.

runners.name: Rosewood Fleetfoot
runners.breeder: C P & Mrs M J A Howells
runners.owner: Lam Ka Lai & Yeung Wing Shut
runners.comment: Placed over 1m2f then pulled too hard off slow pace last time; Purton aboard again here.
runners.spotlight: Showed ability for the first time when 1.25l third in first-time blinkers (at odds of 102-1; 1m2f, Sha Tin), then may have been ill-suited by lack of pace last time; interesting that Zac Purton keeps the ride.

runners.name: S J Tourbillon
runners.owner: Ma Ren De & Dr Ma Yuen Yuen

prev_owners.owner: Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier

runners.comment: On a long losing run but has tumbled down the weights and has shown a little more of late.
runners.spotlight: Unplaced in all 13 runs since latest win, which came over 1m1f here off 23lb lower mark almost two years ago; some signs of a revival in his last two starts so cannot be discounted.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: he's been nurtured along so, I suppose, Group/Classic material is where they really want to end up. I'd be happy enough to say a mile is comfortable enough for him, maybe even back a furlong starting next year - Seamie Heffernan, jockey

runners.name: Management Folks
runners.comment: Gained reward for series of good runs with 0.75l C&D win last time out; now 6lb higher.
runners.spotlight: Broke long win drought when beating six of these rivals by 0.75l and more over C&D three weeks ago; has been raised 6lb for that effort so may struggle to confirm the placings.

runners.name: All Are Mine
runners.comment: Yet to recapture his form after a year-long absence; up in trip today and may prefer dirt.
runners.spotlight: Has failed to make the top five in five attempts since coming back from a year off; only local win came on dirt and he has never been tried over further than 1m1f.

runners.name: Hakka Radiance
runners.comment: Local record now stands at 0-19 but dead-heated for third off 1lb higher three weeks ago.
runners.spotlight: Often runs well but still looking for initial Hong Kong win after 19 attempts; placed off 8lb higher mark over 1m in November; headgear removed for the first time since June.

stable_tour.quote: I have always liked this horse since the day he first set foot in the yard. He opened his account on his third outing, a 1m2f novice stakes at Chelmsford, although he is actually bred to be a miler. Next time out at Goodwood was a bit of an experiment but he failed to stay the extra trip of the Cocked Hat and didn't enjoy the undulations of the South Downs. He goes for the Britannia next week where the straight mile will suit. He is still on the upgrade, his work on fast ground has been good and we are looking forward to next week with him. 14-06-23

runners.name: Perfect Pairing
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Jerry Chow Shiu Ming
runners.comment: Still winless after 14 tries but best run was over this C&D off 1lb lower three weeks ago.
runners.spotlight: Notched best ever placing when 0.75l second to Management Folks over C&D three weeks ago; now 5lb better off with that rival and a stronger pace here could suit.

runners.name: Circuit Duffy
runners.owner: Cheung Ka Shing & Jason Cheung Cho Yee
runners.comment: Has not progressed since a C&D win here off 6lb lower in November; now tries blinkers.
runners.spotlight: Scored over C&D off 6lb lower in November but placed only once from five tries since; does not looks particularly well handicapped but addition of blinkers could bring improvement.

runners.name: Goko Win

prev_owners.owner: Mrs W M Duncan, Mrs M Shaw Et Al

runners.comment: Has not added to C&D triumph off 17lb lower two years ago; four moderate efforts of late.
runners.spotlight: Solitary success from 29 local starts was over this C&D but that was more than two years ago; positive signs when twice second late last year; his four 2025 runs have been underwhelming.

runners.name: Smart Fighter
runners.comment: Dual C&D winner in late 2024; 1m was too far last time so could bounce back.
runners.spotlight: Has largely been tried over further since completing a C&D double off 4lb lower in December; return to this trip is a plus but he needs new personal best to win.

runners.name: Majestic Delight
runners.comment: Registered first placing on his second career start last time but that looked a weak race.
runners.spotlight: Outran his odds of 34-1 when third over C&D last time (just his second career start) but was beaten by 4.25l that day in what may have been an uncompetitive contest.

runners.name: Galvanic
runners.comment: Reasonably weighted and third on each of his last two C&D runs; does not win very often.
runners.spotlight: Irregular winner (just two wins to go with nine placings from 27 runs) but registered C&D thirds off higher marks than this in February and December; could have a say.

runners.name: My Day My Way
runners.comment: Just one promising run (1.5l second on penultimate appearance) from four C&D tries.
runners.spotlight: Has run over this C&D on all four career starts; could be given a squeak if repeating his 1.5l second in March but his other efforts were below that level.

runners.name: Island Buddy
runners.comment: Six-race maiden; has run some fair races and could be invigorated by two months away.
runners.spotlight: The balance of his form gives him a little to find but his best run (a close second at Sha Tin in December) came when fresh, so a recent two-month break could be a good thing.

runners.name: Flying Akeed
runners.comment: Needs to improve upon what he has shown in four races thus far; absent for 53 days.
runners.spotlight: Four moderate efforts at long odds so far, though the best of them came on his debut in December and he has be freshened up for seven weeks since his last run.

runners.name: Good Prospect
runners.comment: Knocking at the door of first win with three C&D second places; should again go well.
runners.spotlight: Runner-up over C&D in three of his last four starts and the handicapper has left him on the same mark as last time so should again play a major role.

runners.name: Vulcanus
runners.comment: Ran a series of good 6f races on dirt before lesser recent runs; not so good on turf.
runners.spotlight: Runner-up off 12lb lower over C&D in November but subsequent improvement came on dirt; seems to have gone off the boil lately and looks opposable back on turf.

runners.name: Team Happy
runners.comment: Well weighted if returning to his autumn form but recent efforts have been below par.
runners.spotlight: In good form earlier this season but recent efforts have been disappointing; now 6lb below his C&D-winning mark from October.

runners.name: Boombayah
runners.comment: No real sign of encouragement on return from long absence two weeks ago (5f).
runners.spotlight: Three modest efforts in 2023 then returned from long layoff with 3.5l ninth of 12 as a 50-1 chance over 5f here two weeks ago; likely to need more time to acquire race sharpness.

runners.name: World Hero
runners.comment: 6f Sha Tin winner who was a modest seventh off this mark last time; reserve.
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at the tenth attempt when scoring by 0.5l off a 6lb lower mark in March; well beaten off this revised rating last time.

runners.name: Casa Rubick
runners.breeder: B J Lindsay Mnzm & Mrs J E A Lindsay
runners.comment: Needs to make massive step up from poor recent C&D debut; new headgear; reserve.
runners.spotlight: Was an 85-1 chance when finishing last of 12 over this C&D on his debut three weeks ago; blinkers replace cheekpieces.

runners.name: Setanta
runners.owner: James Lau Po Man & Alice Woo Wai See

prev_owners.owner: Aquis Farm, C J Barham Et Al

runners.comment: Kept on well for third over C&D a week ago and will appreciate this ease in grade
runners.spotlight: Yet to win this season and evidently not the force of old but kept on well for third over C&D a week ago and is sure to appreciate today's ease in grade.

runners.name: Smart Trio
runners.owner: Peter Lee Kwok Wah, Tony Lau Hon Kwan & Kenny Cheng Tsin Ki

prev_owners.owner: TFI Syndicate & Go Bloodstock Australia Syndicate

runners.comment: A down-the-field outsider on four Hong Kong starts; drops in grade today, at least
runners.spotlight: A down-the-field outsider on four Hong Kong starts, the latest over C&D three weeks ago; drops in grade today but still needs to take a big step forward.

runners.name: Stormi
runners.comment: Placed for first time in Hong Kong when strong-finishing third over C&D last month
runners.spotlight: Won three times on Polytrack when based in Ireland and was placed for first time in Hong Kong when finishing well for third over C&D three weeks ago; shortlisted.

quotes.race: Patton Race
quotes.quote: Bergamasco is a big, honest horse that loves a gallop. He has thrived up here, obviously gets a mile well and likes the surface. I think he is a good advertisement for what we do with a relatively small team of horses - Jack Davison, trainer

runners.name: Mighty Commander

prev_owners.owner: A Boyd, P M Gangemi & Talinga Girls

runners.comment: Gave it a good shot from the front when back in this grade last month; a possible
runners.spotlight: Found things quite tough in Class 3 after his C&D win in January but gave it a pretty good shot from the front when sixth here on last month's return to Class 4, and he's another 2lb lower today; a possible.

runners.name: Flying Wrote
runners.owner: Simon Tsang Heung Tung & Shirley Tsang Huang Yang
runners.comment: In good form over 6f lately; has stamina to prove on first venture beyond 7f
runners.spotlight: In good form over 6f here in recent weeks, most notably when very close second three starts ago, but has stamina to prove on this first venture beyond 7f.

runners.name: Satirical Fan
runners.owner: T W Wong, S S S Yang & C K Ho
runners.comment: Won over C&D a year ago but has not been firing on all cylinders this season
runners.spotlight: Scored off 6lb higher over C&D a year ago and is well drawn today but has not been firing on all cylinders this season.

runners.name: Figopumpkin
runners.owner: Dr Edwin Lam Chi Wan & Jason Lam Che Man
runners.comment: Made low-key debut at Sha Tin (7f) last month; can only be watched here
runners.spotlight: Made low-key debut when down the field over 7f at Sha Tin last month and can only best watched here.

runners.name: Jubilant Winner
runners.comment: Placed on last two outings (6f/7f) and looks well worth a crack at 1m
runners.spotlight: A maiden after seven runs but has been placed four times, including on last two outings at Sha Tin (6f/7f); drawn wide for this first attempt at 1m but has shaped as though well worth a crack at this trip.

runners.name: Deal Completed
runners.comment: Form nosedived after surprise 7f win on seasonal debut; now with another new trainer
runners.spotlight: Caused 35-1 surprise over 7f for Jimmy Ting on seasonal debut but form nosedived soon afterwards; well beaten on debut for Douglas Whyte in March (1m) and has huge amount to prove on first run for latest new stable.

runners.name: Amazing Award
runners.owner: Chan Kwok Yuen, Terence Lun Tin Yeu & Paul Li Cheuk Wai
runners.comment: Won narrowly over C&D in January and has remained in good form since
runners.spotlight: Stayed on for narrow C&D win in January and has remained in good form since; holds no secrets from the handicapper but will probably be in the mix again.

runners.name: Run Run Timing
runners.breeder: G W Holdings A T F The Edwina Trust
runners.owner: Tang Ming, Tang Chak Leung Et Al

prev_owners.owner: Tang Ming, Tang Chak Leung Et Al

runners.comment: Second when upped to 1m for dirt debut in March; still on good mark for first 1m turf run
runners.spotlight: Ran well in defeat when upped to 1m for dirt debut at Sha Tin in March; not quite in same form over that C&D last month but remains on a good mark for this first 1m turf start.

runners.name: Oriental Surprise
runners.comment: Yet to be placed after six starts (6f-1m) and seemingly in need of a drop in grade
runners.spotlight: Yet to be placed after six starts (6f-1m) and seemingly in need of a drop in grade.

runners.name: Swagger Bro
runners.comment: 0-7 over 6f in Hong Kong; needs this new trip to unlock improvement
runners.spotlight: 0-7 over 6f in Hong Kong; placed here three starts ago but needs this longer trip to unlock some improvement.

runners.name: Arthurs Kingdom

prev_owners.owner: Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier
Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier
Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith

runners.comment: Began this season with a win but has lost his way since
runners.spotlight: Began this season with a win but has lost his way since, albeit some positives can be drawn from his 1m1f run here last week.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Arthur's Kingdom had a good run the last day and he was entitled to do that. He stuck at it well and he will stay a lot further next year - Donnacha O'Brien, rider.

runners.name: Multidutch
runners.comment: Dropped in grade and well drawn today but still needs to up his game
runners.spotlight: Won when based in Australia but has been safely held on all three Hong Kong starts (5f-6f); benefits from drop in grade and favourable draw today but still needs to up his game.

runners.name: Aurio

prev_owners.owner: James Harron Bloodstock Colts, Love Racing Et Al

runners.comment: 0-10 in Hong Kong but placed over C&D in Class 3 in February; drops to Class 4 today
runners.spotlight: 0-10 in Hong Kong but was placed over C&D in Class 3 in February and ought to be suited by the drop back to 6f for this first Class 4 run; Zac Purton takes the ride; might be the answer.

runners.name: Loveisintheair
runners.comment: Unexposed 3yo who kept on well for third over C&D last month; one to consider
runners.spotlight: Unexposed 3yo who has performed well on all three appearances, most notably when keeping on well for close third over C&D four weeks ago; drawn much wider today but still enters calculations.

runners.name: King Alloy
runners.breeder: China Horse Club Racing Pty Ltd
runners.owner: Lun Ka Leung & Yeung Hiu Yu
runners.comment: Ran okay on debut (5f) but well beaten over C&D since; now blinkered
runners.spotlight: Made fairly encouraging debut when midfield at Sha Tin (5f) in February but was well beaten over C&D the following month; now sports blinkers.

runners.name: Shotgun
runners.comment: Safely held on first three starts (all 6f) and looks up against it from stall 11 today
runners.spotlight: Safely held on first three starts (all 6f) and looks up against it from stall 11 today.

runners.name: Ace Power
runners.owner: Chan Ngan Chi & Chen Yung Hung
runners.comment: Last-gasp winner off much reduced mark in March but held since; not the force of old
runners.spotlight: Exploited some considerable help from the handicapper in March, running on strongly for a last-gasp C&D win, but managed only sixth from his new mark last month and is evidently not as good as he was.

runners.name: Bits Superstar

prev_owners.owner: R L Roulston, G T Ryan Et Al

runners.comment: Unplaced all ten Hong Kong starts and not the most obvious answer today
runners.spotlight: Unable to land a telling blow (albeit from wide stall) over C&D in February and has now been unplaced all ten Hong Kong starts.

runners.name: Excellent Peers
runners.owner: Chan Tung, Kwan Wah Et Al
runners.comment: On long losing run but scores good marks for his consistency in recent months
runners.spotlight: Without a win since 2022 but scores good marks for his consistency over C&D in recent months and continues to edge down the weights; probably won't be far away.

runners.name: Brave Joy
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Matthew Lam Kin Hong
runners.comment: Yet to show anything more than minor promise after five runs and has a tough draw today
runners.spotlight: Yet to show anything more than minor promise after five runs and has a tough draw today.

runners.name: Super Charizzard
runners.comment: Dual C&D winner in Class 5 this season and holding his own at this higher level lately
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner in Class 5 this season; holding his own at this higher level lately and has much better draw than last time; considered each-way.

runners.name: Always My Folks
runners.breeder: S F Bloodstock L L C
runners.comment: Placed at Sha Tin in January but some lesser efforts have followed; others preferred
runners.spotlight: Improved form when second at Sha Tin in January, his third run, but some lesser efforts have followed and he looks risky, despite his favourable draw.

runners.name: Telecom Power
runners.owner: Cheung King Shek, Billy Cheung King Shan Et Al

prev_owners.owner: Pulse Dream Genie, P M O'Shea Et Al

runners.comment: 0-17 in Hong Kong but has twice finished second over C&D in recent weeks; considered
runners.spotlight: 0-17 in Hong Kong but has twice finished second over C&D in recent weeks and, from stall 4, can make his presence felt again.

runners.name: Run Yes Run
runners.breeder: J W Kelly Suffolk Vale & Co
runners.owner: Kong Wing Ming & Edmond Kong Chun Man
runners.comment: Showed promise in novice company last season but has struggled in handicaps this term
runners.spotlight: Showed promise in novice company last season but has struggled to make an impact in handicaps this term.

runners.name: E Universe
runners.comment: Lurks on a good mark but was safely held over C&D three weeks ago
runners.spotlight: Lurks on a good mark but was safely held over C&D three weeks ago and needs to get back in the groove.

runners.name: Ivy League

prev_owners.owner: Westerberg, Mrs J Magnier, M Tabor, D Smith

runners.comment: Yet to win this season but made the frame in higher-grade C&D race last month; big player
runners.spotlight: Yet to win this season but ran well from the front when fourth over C&D last month and a subsequent 2lb drop enables today's drop in grade; high on the list.

quotes.race: Naas Racecourse Business Club Blackwater Handicap
quotes.quote: Ivy League did that nicely. He's a big strong colt and he's very babyish still, he will progress and is probably not too bad. I don't think he'll have any problem stepping into stakes company. He is not short of pace. He would love horses in front of him and a race like the Jersey Stakes could be a good option for him - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

runners.name: Comet Splendido

prev_owners.owner: York Forty Four Ltd And Grant Tuer

runners.comment: Has struggled to make an impact in Class 3 this season but dips back into Class 4 today
runners.spotlight: Has struggled to make a significant impact in Class 3 this season but his C&D fourth in January was a good effort; dips back into Class 4 today and has possibilities, despite his awkward draw.

runners.name: Bucephalas
runners.comment: Has made a low-key start to his HK career but ought to be more competitive in this grade
runners.spotlight: Ex-Australian 4yo who has made a low-key start to his Hong Kong career in 7f Class 3 races at Sha Tin this year (four runs); moves back up in trip today, though, and ought to be more competitive in this grade.

runners.name: Thesis
runners.comment: Twice in the frame since C&D win in February; wants a strong pace to aim at
runners.spotlight: Has twice made the frame since finishing well for narrow C&D win in February; did not have race run to suit when only eighth here last time; can get closer to the target if there's a stronger early pace today.

quotes.race: Britannia Stakes (Heritage Handicap) (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: Thesis won off 90 today, he's heading towards 100 now. I think he's a good horse. He was the biggest horse in the field; he's got scope and size, so hopefully he can progress - Harry Charlton, joint-trainer.

runners.name: Positive Smile
runners.comment: Safely held when upped to 7f and dropped to this grade last month; another new trip today
runners.spotlight: Competitive in Class 3 sprints this season but was safely held when upped to 7f and dropped to this grade last month; has a bit to prove on this first attempt at 1m.

runners.name: Iconical
runners.comment: Readily made all under Zac Purton here last month; 6lb higher and drawn on outside today
runners.spotlight: Came good at seventh attempt, readily making all over C&D under Zac Purton three weeks ago; 6lb higher and has the outside draw to contend with today.

runners.name: Silver Up
runners.owner: E C H Wong & Ms A S C Chu
runners.comment: Has been disappointing this year and is now 0-14 in Hong Kong
runners.spotlight: Left Mark Newnham after some disappointing efforts at start of this year and made a low-key stable debut last month; now 0-14 in Hong Kong; others have much more obvious claims.

runners.name: Gor Mo Tuen
runners.comment: Out of form this season and difficult to enthuse over
runners.spotlight: Badly out of sorts for David Hayes this season and there has been no significant upturn for Benno Yung lately; difficult to enthuse over.

runners.name: Owners Praise
runners.comment: Returned to form and outran 43-1 odds when second over C&D last month; still on good mark
runners.spotlight: Returned to form and outran 43-1 odds when second to Iconical over C&D three weeks ago; it's hard to tell whether he'll build on that performance today but he remains well handicapped.

runners.name: Chill Master
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Francis Lee Bing Kwong & Yves Lee Kun Fun
runners.comment: Unplaced all four starts; upped from 6f today; makes only limited appeal
runners.spotlight: Unplaced all four starts; made some late headway into midfield over 6f last month and may benefit from today's step up in trip but still makes only limited appeal.

runners.name: Jumbo Fortune
runners.comment: Has very modest HK strike-rate but has been consistent over C&D lately and is well drawn
runners.spotlight: Has very modest 1-54 strike-rate in Hong Kong but has been consistent over C&D in recent weeks and competes off another career-low mark today; can make his presence felt from stall 1.

runners.name: Lucky Banner
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Stephen Ho Wai Man, F Ho Ka Chun & D Ho Ka Chung
runners.comment: Out of sorts on recent outings and needs to turn a corner
runners.spotlight: Placed four consecutive times over 1m on turf/dirt at start of this season but out of sorts on recent outings and needs to turn a corner.

runners.name: Concorde Star
runners.owner: Philip Yu Chi Wai & Dr Jennie Peterson Yu
runners.comment: Has struggled in 6f/7f handicaps this season and is now eligible for a drop in grade
runners.spotlight: Has struggled in 6f/7f handicaps this season and is now eligible for a drop in grade; upped to 1m for first time today.

runners.name: Alluring Laos
runners.comment: Scored over 5f on debut in November but more recent sprint runs have been underwhelming
runners.spotlight: Scored over 5f on debut in November but his more recent sprint runs have been underwhelming; has a point to prove on first 1m attempt.

runners.name: M Unicorn
runners.comment: Disappointed last month but earlier win was career-best form; good 7lb claimer booked
runners.spotlight: Late-maturing 6yo who posted a career-best performance when winning emphatically by 2l in March; disappointed here last month but Ellie Wong claims a useful 7lb today.

runners.name: Keefy

prev_owners.owner: B K Racing & Breeding, Raffles Thoroughbred Racing Et Al

runners.comment: Back in better form over 7f lately but has poor strike-rate in recent years
runners.spotlight: Belied 63-1 odds when staying-on third over 7f two starts ago and again ran well over that trip last month but is no longer the force of old and has a poor strike-rate in recent years; not the percentage call.

runners.name: Legendary Years
runners.breeder: K D Landrigan & P J Landrigan
runners.comment: Listed winner in New Zealand last May but a well-beaten outsider on recent Hong Kong debut
runners.spotlight: Delivered on debut promise when winning 1m Listed race in New Zealand last May but was well-beaten outsider on recent Hong Kong debut (7f).

runners.name: Samarkand

prev_owners.owner: Mrs M E Baker, Mrs R E Nicholson Et Al

runners.comment: Back on a good mark now but finished down the field last time and needs to up his game
runners.spotlight: Won four times here last season (1m-1m1f) and is back on a good mark now but finished down the field behind M Unicorn on latest outing in March and needs to up his game.

runners.name: Absolute Honour

prev_owners.owner: Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor

runners.comment: A very promising 2yo in Ireland last year but safely held on first three Hong Kong starts
runners.spotlight: A very promising 2yo in Ireland last year but safely held on first three Hong Kong starts (6f-7f); improvement needed on this first attempt at 1m.

quotes.race: Tipperary Races Median Auction Maiden (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Surpass is a work in progress, he's still very babyish and when he puts it all together he has the makings of a lovely horse. He could go for a race like the Tyros Stakes now - Chris Armstrong, stable representative.

runners.name: Charity Together
runners.comment: Progressive handicap in Britain last year but made low-key Hong Kong debut last month
runners.spotlight: Progressive handicapper in Britain last year, signing off with three consecutive wins (7f/1m) in August/September, but was unable to land a telling blow over C&D on last month's Hong Kong debut.

quotes.race: Welcome To Family Day Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: When Corriamo is three and he's had a winter over him, he'll be a very strong horse, and I'd expect to see him in some better races. We hope it's onwards and upwards with him. He didn't handle coming down the hill for whatever reason, he was a bit slowly away and he couldn't quite go that early pace. He was a bit green, but we're very pleased - Marcus Tregoning, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Highland Rahy
runners.owner: Peter Chu Ka Lok, Maria Teresa Chu & Dr C Chu Ping Wing
runners.comment: Bang-in-form front runner; lost out only narrowly on recent hat-trick attempt; respected
runners.spotlight: Bang-in-form front-runner who won consecutive C&D races in March/April and lost out only by a neck here on latest outing; nudged up another 2lb since last time but ought to give this another good shot.

runners.name: Win Beauty Viva
runners.comment: Won 1m maiden in Australia in November; makes Hong Kong debut after six-month absence
runners.spotlight: Won 1m maiden in Australia in November; makes Hong Kong debut after six-month absence and from a wide stall but it will be interesting to see how he fares.

runners.name: Casa Rochester
runners.comment: Off mark in HK with narrow C&D win last month; back up in grade today but well drawn
runners.spotlight: Delivered on earlier Hong Kong promise when leading on the post over C&D last month; moves back up in grade today but is drawn on the inside and might have a bit more to offer.

runners.name: Lucky Touch
runners.comment: In the frame eight consecutive times on turf/dirt since his C&D win in November
runners.spotlight: In the frame eight consecutive times on turf/dirt since C&D win in November; holds no secrets from the handicapper but is reunited with Zac Purton today and, from stall 3, will probably be in the shake-up again.

runners.name: Quantum Patch

prev_owners.owner: David Spratt & Sean Jones & Mrs Lynne Lyons

runners.comment: Quickly back up in grade after very close second here last month; each-way claims
runners.spotlight: Without a win since November 2023 but pretty consistent this year; quickly back up in grade after very close second to Casa Rochester over C&D last month; each-way claims at least.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Bingo Bronson is a nice horse. He's very much a baby, he loved that ground, and I would say you won't see the best of him till next year - Ger Lyons, trainer.

runners.name: Fortunate Son
runners.breeder: A M Aldridge, Mrs F V & G F Moughan

prev_owners.owner: M C Sharkie, P Vawdrey & D Painter

runners.comment: Back in good form with close third over C&D last month and remains well handicapped
runners.spotlight: Well handicapped on early-season form and took big step back in right direction when close third over C&D three weeks ago; major player if able to build upon that recent effort.

runners.name: Embraces
runners.owner: Thomas Chung Yat Fan & Joe Ho Pui Lung
runners.comment: Won twice over 1m in December/January and is still in good form
runners.spotlight: Started off for Cody Mo with two 1m wins (one here) in December/January and has remained in good form since; will warrant consideration if he gets a run today.

runners.name: Northern Beast
runners.owner: Ngai Man, Amy Wang Hong & Doris Ngai Yan Tung
runners.comment: Class 4 C&D winner in February but has suffered alarming slump in form lately
runners.spotlight: Placed over 1m1f in this higher grade since Class 4 C&D win in February but has suffered alarming slump in form lately.

runners.name: Superb Capitalist
runners.owner: Li Cham Kuen & Li Ming Choi
runners.comment: Placed twice at start of this season but generally very disappointing since
runners.spotlight: Placed twice at Sha Tin at start of this season but generally very disappointing since, and has the outside draw today.

runners.name: Fast Responder
runners.owner: Hong Kong St John Presidents Club Syndicate
runners.comment: Yet to build upon his 5f win in January but is well drawn for this return to 6f
runners.spotlight: Came good in Hong Kong at sixth attempt, with pushed-out 5f win in January; three lesser efforts have followed and he's not one to rely upon but at least he's well drawn for this return to 6f.

quotes.race: Newmarket Academy Godolphin Beacon Project Cornwallis Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: I wasn't that confident beforehand (because of the ground), but Inquisitively is a very tough horse. He took the lead and grabbed the race from the get go. When I saw three horses in line halfway through the race I was a bit worried, but as William says he breathes very well and relaxes. When he asked him to quicken up he put it to bed very nicely. I think he is a five-furlong horse, but we will probably have to try the six (furlongs) later down the line. He was sold to go to Hong Kong, but he worked very well at mine so I asked if I could run him at York. He ran at York and won, and we decided to go for one more today. I would love to keep him, but we will have to speak to the owner. You have a question mark on the Breeders' Cup obviously. It is a long way out and we will have to discuss. It is not out of the question - Kevin Philippart de Foy, trainer.

runners.name: Beauty Infinity
runners.comment: In good form this year but appears to have very little margin for error off current mark
runners.spotlight: Looked as good as ever when scoring over C&D in March and last month's C&D fifth was perfectly respectable; well draw again today but appears to have very little margin for error off current mark.

runners.name: Chateauneuf
runners.comment: Close third over C&D last month; can make bold bid from stall 1 today
runners.spotlight: Has posted some good efforts in defeat since C&D win in October, most recently when close third here three weeks ago; on a workable mark and can make a bold bid from stall 1.

runners.name: Super Joy N Fun
runners.owner: Johnny Wong Chun Nam, Nancy Wong Et Al
runners.comment: Inconsistent since C&D win in September but has a fighting chance if on a going day
runners.spotlight: Rather inconsistent since winning over C&D on seasonal debut in September but went close here two starts ago and has a fighting chance if on a going day today.

runners.name: Wolf Coming
runners.comment: Signed off in Britain with two heavy-ground wins last year; makes Hong Kong debut today
runners.spotlight: Signed off in Britain with two heavy-ground 6f wins last year; will be suited by the forecast rain on this Hong Kong debut but has fitness to prove and is probably best watched.

quotes.race: William Hill / British EBF Restricted Novice Stakes (Bands A, B, C And D) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It's never easy carrying a penalty, so that was a really pleasing effort from Qetaifan. I'll have to discuss with the owner what the next steps are but he has shown he can cope with that ground, so we might look at the Horris Hill for him. He's also in the sales - Andrew Balding, trainer.

runners.name: Lucky Planet
runners.owner: Leung Kai Fai & Cheung Sui Ling
runners.comment: Hiked up 11lb for last month's dominant C&D win but still commands respect
runners.spotlight: Dominated from the front over C&D three weeks ago, scoring comfortably by 4l, and is now 2-3 for new stable; recent 11lb rise asks a lot of him but he still commands respect in current mood.

runners.name: Wave Garden
runners.comment: Well beaten on both Hong Kong starts and has double-digit draw today
runners.spotlight: 2-2 over 7f in New Zealand last June but well beaten over 6f on both Hong Kong starts and has double-digit draw today.

runners.name: Fatal Blow
runners.breeder: China Horse Club Racing Pty Ltd
runners.comment: Narrow C&D winner last month and now 2-5; has tough draw for first Class 3 run
runners.spotlight: Suffered mid-season dip in form but returned from break with narrow C&D win last month and is now 2-5; could still have a bigger run in him but has tough draw for this first run in Class 3.

runners.name: King Miles
runners.owner: Bernie Yim Mei Fung & Yim Man Hay
runners.comment: Back in good nick over C&D last month; Zac Purton sidles in for the ride today
runners.spotlight: Well handicapped on early-season form and looked back in good nick when close second over C&D three weeks ago; might have been drawn better today but Zac Purton sidles in for the ride; shortlisted.

runners.name: Basic Instinct
runners.owner: 22/23 Me Tsui Yu Sak Trainer Syndicate
runners.comment: Cut little ice on first three Hong Kong starts; needs a drop in grade
runners.spotlight: Won when based in New Zealand but cut little ice on first three Hong Kong starts and will soon be eligible for a drop in grade.

runners.name: Jolly Ruler
runners.comment: Won off reduced mark in Class 4 last month but younger rivals have more appealing profiles
runners.spotlight: Won readily over C&D in Class 4 a fortnight ago, exploiting some help from the handicapper, but moves back up in grade today and younger rivals have more appealing profiles.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Maiden Stakes (Colts & Geldings) (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Helmont has been doing a lot right at home and looked the part. I was pleased with how he went through the gap and he won like a nice horse - Richard Kingscote, jockey.

runners.name: Lucky Eight
runners.comment: Resurgent 6yo who went close over C&D on his last two appearances
runners.spotlight: Resurgent 6yo who went close over C&D on his last two appearances; can give another good account if he gets a run today but recent 2lb nudge might be enough to leave him vulnerable.
